column13: Solution Description

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: Hydrogen engine development refers to the ongoing efforts, research, and activities focused on designing, optimizing, and manufacturing internal combustion engines that operate on hydrogen as a fuel source. Hydrogen engines are a type of powertrain technology that uses hydrogen gas as the primary fuel to generate mechanical power and propel vehicles or operate machinery.

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: Natural gas consumption contributes to our scope 1 emissions, especially in Germany, which accounts for more than 60% of Sonic's total natural gas emissions. Some of our sites have converted from gas to electricity; further gas use reduction initiatives are currently being explored.

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: At Melbourne Pathology in Victoria, Australia, similar in-car chargeable fridges/freezers have been used in all courier cars since early 2022, resulting in a 70% reduction in dry ice usage across the practice. These crucial developments are challenging the current practices for specimen transportation across all of Sonic, with further use of in-car fridges/freezers to reduce dry ice usage expected across the Group.

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: Sonic's USA division has also recently contracted renewably sourced power for our largest facility in Texas (equivalent to around 18% of Sonic USA's electricity usage) and is actively investigating the feasibility of contracting renewable power in some of the other states in which we have operations. The benefits of this project will be reflected in our FY2024 calculations.

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: In Ingelheim, Germany, a 240kW capacity installation is under construction, with 100kW in use since March 2023. Additional panels, with more than 170kW capacity at Munich, Hamburg and Limburg sites, will also come online over the next 12Ã¢ÂÂ18 months.

column6: Emissions of ozone-depleting substances (ODS)
Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column7: Sonic's operations generate significant amounts of waste, which can contribute to climate change and air pollution, directly affecting many ecosystems and species. Landfills, considered the last resort in the waste hierarchy, release methane, a potent greenhouse gas linked to climate change.\t

column6: Management of significant waste-related impacts
column7: Disposal method data refers to the methods used to manage or dispose waste materials. This data encompasses details about how waste is handled, processed, treated, or disposed of once it reaches the end of its life cycle.

column6: Waste generated
Waste diverted from disposal
Waste directed to disposal
Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: The Sonic Supplier Policy explicitly outlines our expectations that suppliers conduct their business in a way that promotes environmental sustainability, adhere to all relevant environmental laws and regulations and aims to reduce waste. Moreover, the Sonic Supplier Policy requests that all significant suppliers work towards setting credible emissions reduction targets that align with the Paris Agreement to limit global warming to below 2ÃÂ°C.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column7: During FY2023, Sonic employed 9,175 new people to replace vacant existing roles or to fill newly created roles. Women filled 75% of these new hires.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
Parental leave
column7: As over 40% of our workforce is under 40 and more than 70% are women, access to parental leave is an essential consideration for many existing and prospective staff. Nine hundred thirty employees (representing 2.3% of total employees) took parental leave during the year, with 80.6% returning to work after their leave.

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column13: A zero-harm workplace refers to an organizational commitment and culture that aims to eliminate all workplace injuries, accidents, and incidents to ensure all employees' health, safety, and wellbeing. The concept revolves around creating an environment where every person, whether an employee, contractor, or visitor, can perform their work without experiencing harm or injury.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: The SonicSAFE OH&S framework is continually reviewed to ensure it is achieving its intended purpose. Regular worker participation, consultation and communication concerning work health and safety policy setting, reporting and management is facilitated through a network of site-based, entity-based and divisional safety committees.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: This systematic process is used in occupational health and safety management to identify workplace hazards, assess associated risks, and determine effective control measures. Effective control aims to create a safer work environment by systematically addressing hazards, assessing risks, and implementing appropriate control measures to protect workers' health and wellbeing.

column6: Occupational health services
column13: A network of site-based systems refers to a system or structure within Sonic's Occupational Health and Safety program that involves various sites, locations, or facilities. In occupational health and safety, sonic often implements site-based approaches to manage and improve workplace safety.

column6: Occupational health services
column13: Divisional safety committees refer to committees established within different divisions or departments of an organization with the primary purpose of addressing and managing safety-related matters. These committees are crucial in promoting a safety culture, identifying and mitigating hazards, and fostering communication and collaboration on safety issues within specific organizational divisions.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Software-based notification uses computer software or digital tools to facilitate the organization's notification, reporting, and communication of health and safety-related information. This approach leverages technology to streamline and enhance the efficiency of OHS processes, ensuring that relevant information is communicated promptly, accurately, and in a centralized manner.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Regular reporting is the systematic and periodic submission of information, data, or reports related to Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) within an organization. This reporting is fundamental to OHS management systems, enabling organizations to monitor, evaluate, and improve their safety performance.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: At an entity level, safety training is an ongoing function embedded in our quality assurance and health and safety programs. Additional training is also undertaken externally where the need arises.

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Sonic will continue to monitor this critical aspect of employee well-being over the coming years as Sonic expands the reach of its employee assistance programs (EAP). EAPs generally offer confidential counselling to support the mental health, emotional and general psychological wellbeing of staff and, often, their immediate family members.

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Sonic conducts an annual global audit to determine which employees can access assistance (EAP) or comparable support programs. The FY2023 audit found that 78.6% of our global employed workforce can access EAPs.

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Sonic workplace health and safety refers to the set of practices, policies, and procedures put in place to promote and protect the health, safety, and wellbeing of employees and others who may be affected by the activities of a workplace. The primary goal of workplace health and safety is to prevent accidents, injuries, illnesses, and fatalities in the work environment.

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: An Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) Management System is a structured framework and set of processes designed to ensure national health and safety within an effective organization. An OHS management system aims to provide a systematic approach to identifying, assessing, controlling, and continually improving health and safety risks in the workplace.

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column7: OH&S Management Systems covers all Sonic employees and those contracted to work at Sonic's instruction. Sonic workplaces are audited to ensure they meet the requirements of SonicSAFE.

column6: Work-related injuries
column7: No work-related fatalities occurred during the year across Sonic, Sonic's global lost-time injury frequency rate (LTIFR) for FY2023 was 3.6 per one million hours worked.

column6: Work-related ill health
Average hours of training per year per employee
column7: Average 16 hours of training per employee for FY2023.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In Australia, trainee sonographers must complete 2,200 hours of supervised training before receiving accreditation. Like most Sonic Healthcare radiology practices, Hunter Imaging Group (HIG) provides student training in regional NSW, Australia.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Sonic has a global reputation for quality and professionalism. We continually explore ways to position ourselves as an 'employer of choice.' with current and prospective employees by offering an attractive employee value proposition. Our staff retention rates reflect the respect and care we show our staff and the rewarding nature of our meaningful work.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: This comprehensive program is designed to equip graduates with the knowledge, skills and confidence to perform their roles fully. In addition, the program will showcase the knowledge and skills of IPN's existing nurses, recognizing them as leaders shaping the future of nursing in primary care.
